snippet: Edward Bouchet has long been recognized as the school’s first African-American graduate, but newly uncovered records suggest another man earned that distinction nearly 20 years earlier.
abstract: Newly uncovered records show that Yale University awarded bachelor's degree to African American Richard Henry Green in 1857, making Green first black man to graduate from Yale; revelation strips distinction from Edward Bouchet, long considered to be university's first black graduate.
lead_paragraph: Edward Bouchet has long been recognized as the school’s first African-American graduate, but newly uncovered records suggest another man earned that distinction nearly 20 years earlier.

headline.main: Discovery Leads Yale to Revise a Chapter of Its Black History
headline.print_headline: Discovery Leads Yale to Revise a Chapter of Its Black History
